plugin_desc: Used for monitoring RabbitMQ's runtime status, resource usage, message flow, and queue health.
name: RabbitMQ

metrics.name: rabbitmq_exchange_publish_in_rate
metrics.description: This metric shows the rate of messages published to the RabbitMQ exchange per second. It helps identify bottlenecks in message inflow.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_exchange_publish_out_rate
metrics.description: This metric shows the rate of messages published out of the RabbitMQ exchange per second. It helps identify issues in message outflow.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_node_disk_free
metrics.description: This metric indicates the free disk space on the RabbitMQ node, in bytes. Low disk space can lead to performance degradation or failures.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_node_fd_used
metrics.description: This metric shows the number of file descriptors used by the RabbitMQ node. Excessive use may prevent the system from handling additional connections.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_node_mem_used
metrics.description: This metric indicates the memory usage on the RabbitMQ node. High memory usage may lead to performance issues or node crashes.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_node_run_queue
metrics.description: This metric shows the number of queues currently being handled by the RabbitMQ node. A high number may indicate system pressure and need for optimization.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_node_uptime
metrics.description: This metric indicates the uptime of the RabbitMQ node, in seconds. Nodes running for extended periods may require a restart to free resources and perform maintenance.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_fd_usage_ratio
metrics.description: This metric shows the ratio of used file descriptors to the total number of file descriptors on the RabbitMQ node.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_overview_messages_ready
metrics.description: This metric indicates the number of messages ready for processing. A high number of ready messages may indicate consumer lag or slow processing speed.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_overview_messages_unacked
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of unacknowledged messages. A high number of unacknowledged messages may indicate slow consumer processing or backlog.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_queue_message_backlog_ratio
metrics.description: This metric shows the ratio of ready messages to acked messages in the queue, helping to identify message backlog in the system.

metrics.name: rabbitmq_unacked_message_ratio
metrics.description: This metric shows the ratio of unacknowledged messages to the total messages in the queue, helping to identify slow consumers.
